intro: Dacrydium fonkii, commonly known as the New Caledonia pine, is a coniferous tree native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, evergreen foliage and conical shape. The plant has needle-like leaves that are usually arranged in spirals around the stems. Its cones are small and typically hang from the branches, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Dacrydium fonkii plays an important ecological role in the unique flora of New Caledonia's humid forests.
